question: How to change a headlight.

question: How to patch up a hole in drywall.
option1: Cut around the area of the hole into a square, then measure the square and cut another piece of drywall to size. Hold the new piece in place and drill to the studs. Place joint tape around the edges, then use a joint knife to apply putty. Sand it down when it's dry and wipe clean with a wet washcloth.
option2: Cut around the area of the hole into a square, then measure the square and cut another piece of drywall to size. Hold the new piece in place and scotch tape it to the studs. Place joint tape around the edges, then use a joint knife to apply putty. Sand it down when it's dry and wipe clean with a wet washcloth.

question: How do I use baking soda to whiten my teeth?

question: cook bacon in the oven

question: how can I quickly clean a bong?
option1: Empty the bong and rinse and fill it with warm water. While wearing your latex gloves, empty out your bong as well as you can. Pour out old bong water and remove any spent herb. Then give it a good rinse with warm water to remove any remaining solid particles. Finally, fill the bong part way with some of the vegetable soup from dinner.
option2: Empty the bong and rinse and fill it with warm water. While wearing your latex gloves, empty out your bong as well as you can. Pour out old bong water and remove any spent herb. question: How to make a tinder bundle.

question: use a wine opener
option1: Push the tip of the corkscrew into the cork.    Twist until the corkscrew is about three-quarters of the way into the cork.    Engage the base hinge with the lip of the bottle and push downward gently.    When you can't pull anymore, engage the second hinge with the lip of the bottle.
option2: Push the tip of the corkscrew into the cork.    Twist until the corkscrew is about three-quarters of the way into the cork.    Engage the base hinge with the lip of the bottle and pull upward gently.    When you can't pull anymore, engage the second hinge with the lip of the bottle.

question: how to make basic liquid soap
option1: Gather 8 to 10 ounces of soap. Grate the soap into large chunks of shaving soap. Add some glycerin if you're not using castile or handmade soap. Let the soap water sit off-heat for 12 to 24 hours. Whisk the soap the next morning, if needed. Stir in any desired essential oils or extracts.Pour the soap into soap dispensers
option2: Gather 8 to 10 ounces of soap. Grate the soap into small flakes.Heat 1 gallonof water on a stove. Stir the soap into the water. Add some glycerin if you're not using castile or handmade soap. Let the soap water sit off-heat for 12 to 24 hours. Whisk the soap the next morning, if needed. Stir in any desired essential oils or extracts.Pour the soap into soap dispensers
